description:
Starting around patch set 8, there is discussion in this patch about the history/reason why the powervm driver is doing checksum validation for the image after it's sent/received from the backing hypervisor:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42965/

That brings up this paste: http://paste.openstack.org/show/48516/

That's a set of stale images left on the backing hypervisor that we run our havana ppc64 tempest runs against.

We obviously need to implement the manage_image_cache virt driver method in the powervm driver to clean those up.

This will be a blocker for getting PowerVM CI into the community for Icehouse.
title: powervm driver needs to implement manage_image_cache

comments.content:
Starting around patch set 8, there is discussion in this patch about the history/reason why the powervm driver is doing checksum validation for the image after it's sent/received from the backing hypervisor:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42965/

That brings up this paste: http://paste.openstack.org/show/48516/

That's a set of stale images left on the backing hypervisor that we run our havana ppc64 tempest runs against.

We obviously need to implement the manage_image_cache virt driver method in the powervm driver to clean those up.

This will be a blocker for getting PowerVM CI into the community for Icehouse.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem
